snippet: The parent company of Iberia announced a sweeping restructuring that will eliminate at least 4,500 jobs and cut capacity by 15 percent.
abstract: International Airlines Group, parent company of Iberia, warns that a deepening recession in Spain and heightened competition from low-cost airlines has placed it in a fight for survival; company announces a sweeping reorganization that would eliminate 4,500 jobs and cut capacity by 15 percent.
lead_paragraph: The parent company of Iberia announced a sweeping restructuring that will eliminate at least 4,500 jobs and cut capacity by 15 percent.

headline.main: Iberia, in ‘Fight for Survival,’ Says It Will Reorganize
headline.print_headline: Iberia, in ‘Fight for Survival,’ Says It Will Reorganize

keywords.value: Iberia Lineas Aereas de Espana SA
